reference.title: Types of LinkedIn Access Roles
reference.shortdesc: LinkedIn offers different levels of account access based on user needs. The five possible roles are: super admin, content admin, curator, and analyst.

section.title: Super admin permissions
section.p: The super admin classification has the most authority over a page's content.

ul.li: Manage Page and paid media admins
Edit all availabe fields of the Page
Approve association between company and developer application
Create, manage, comment on, and react to posts and Sponsored Content as the Page
Untag Page from photos posted by members

section.title: Content admin permissions
section.p: The content admin classification is slightly more restricted than the super admin but still gives the user a wide range of control.

ul.li: Create, manage, comment on, and react to posts and Sponsored Content as the Page
Untag Page from photos posted by members

section.title: Curator permissions
section.p: The curator classification is the second to most restricted on LinkedIn and does not allow the user approval authority over content.

section.title: Analyst permissions
section.p: The analyst classification only allows a user to view and export analytics.
